intro: Sabia transarisanensis, commonly known as the Transarisan sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the Transarisan region of Indonesia. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in coastal or semi-arid environments. It is often found in open habitats such as dunes or coastal scrub. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
